questions.question: During EDA, which of the following visualizations is most useful for identifying outliers?

explanations.a: Histograms help understand distributions but are not specifically for outlier detection.
explanations.b: Correct! Box plots are widely used in EDA to detect outliers and understand data spread.
explanations.c: Pie charts show proportions, not outliers.
explanations.d: Line plots are useful for trends in time-series data, not outliers.

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used in EDA to check for missing values in a dataset?

explanations.a: Value counts summarizes categorical values but doesn't show missing values.
explanations.b: Correct! Null value analysis checks how many values are missing in each column.
explanations.c: Scatter plots show relationships between variables, not missing values.
explanations.d: Pie charts do not reveal missing data.

questions.question: What is a pair plot used for in EDA?

answers.a: Visualizing relationships between multiple numerical variables
answers.c: Showing the distribution of a single feature

explanations.a: Correct! Pair plots display pairwise relationships between numerical variables.
explanations.b: Missing data is not visualized with pair plots.
explanations.c: A histogram or box plot is used for single-feature distribution.
explanations.d: Pair plots are not used specifically for time-series analysis.

questions.question: Which descriptive statistics method helps summarize central tendency and variability?

explanations.a: Correct! These descriptive statistics help summarize important properties of numerical data.
explanations.b: Scatter plots show relationships, not statistics.
explanations.c: Heatmaps show correlations or patterns, not descriptive metrics.
explanations.d: Feature engineering creates new features but does not summarize existing ones.

questions.question: Which visualization helps understand the distribution of a numerical variable?

explanations.a: Correct! Histograms show how numerical values are distributed across ranges.
explanations.b: Bar charts are used for categorical data.
explanations.c: Correlation matrices show relationships between variables.
explanations.d: Pair plots show pairwise relationships, not single-variable distribution.

questions.question: In EDA, what does a correlation matrix help identify?

explanations.a: Outliers are detected using box plots, not correlation matrices.
explanations.b: Correct! Correlation matrices show the strength and direction of relationships between numerical features.
explanations.c: Missing values are identified through null-value analysis.
explanations.d: Categorical distributions are shown using bar charts.
